main event: On April 6, 1957, at Floyd Bennett, New York, an object appearing bell-shaped and silver, similar to a satellite, was observed for 45 seconds. It moved erratically, oscillated, and then disappeared from view.
interesting points: The object was described as bell-shaped, similar to a satellite, and appeared silvery and metallic.
It moved erratically and oscillated before disappearing from view.
The report includes identifying information of the observers - Captain Vertiichilla and Captain Geddis from Floyd Bennett NAS.
There were 11 objects observed in total during the sighting.
